generated_text:
- road: The cobblestone surface in the foreground and extending into the background is a road, as it is the surface on which vehicles (including the car from which the photo is taken) travel.
- sidewalk: The paved area on the right side of the image, adjacent to the road and bordered by a curb, is a sidewalk designated for pedestrians or cyclists.
- building: The structure with storefronts, doors, and windows on the left and center of the image is a building.
- wall: The large, stone-faced structure on the right side of the image is a standalone wall, separate from the main building.
- vegetation: There are numerous trees and greenery visible in the background on the right side of the image.
- person: A person is visible riding a bicycle in the distance on the right side of the image.
- rider: The person riding the bicycle is a rider, as they are using a bicycle to move.
- car: A dark-colored car is visible parked on the right side of the image in the background.
- pole: A small, vertical pole with a traffic sign attached is visible on the right side of the image.
- traffic sign: A circular traffic sign is mounted on the pole on the right side of the image.
- bicycle: A bicycle is visible in the distance on the right side of the image, being ridden by a person.
